@pytest.mark.parametrize("case", TEST_DATA["invalid_cases"], ids=[c["title"] for c in TEST_DATA["invalid_cases"]]) def test_update_datetime_format_invalid_cases(case, auth_token): # Default valid setup target_endpoint = ENDPOINT headers = { "Content-Type": "application/json", "Authorization": f"Bearer {auth_token}" }
# Custom logic for specific failure scenarios if case["title"] == "User not found": fake_email = "unknown.user.999@test.com" target_endpoint = f"{BASE_URL}/api/profile/{fake_email}/thinxfresh/update-date-time-format"
if case["title"] == "Invalid user identifier": # Simulate invalid format in URL bad_email = "invalid-email-format-xyz" target_endpoint = f"{BASE_URL}/api/profile/{bad_email}/thinxfresh/update-date-time-format"
if case["title"] == "Unauthorized role": headers["Authorization"] = "Bearer invalid_token_simulating_unauthorized"
response = requests.put( target_endpoint, headers=headers, json=case["payload"], verify=False )
print(f"DEBUG: Status: {response.status_code}, Body: {response.text}") > assert response.status_code == case["expected_status"] E assert 200 == 400 E + where 200 = <Response [200]>.status_code
tests\test_update_datetime_format_ddt.py:71: AssertionError
